snippet: The blurred line between forced and voluntary sex labor complicates efforts to free women.
abstract: The blurred line between forced and voluntary sex labor complicates efforts to free women.
lead_paragraph: “Minati, 19, was never meant to be rescued from a brothel here in the red light district of Kolkata, India,” Natalie Kitroeff wrote in The New York Times. “When Nick Kristof accompanied the International Justice Mission and the police on a raid in a brothel in the Songachi district last year, they were looking for a girl much younger.”

headline.main: Life After Escaping an Indian Brothel
